articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Wi In Chan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Wi In Chan
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of Wi In Chan, an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter, on Monday, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Condolences Expressed over Death of Russian Patriarch
articles.content:
Condolences Expressed over Death of Russian Patriarch
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Jang Jae On, chairman of the Korean Council of Religionists, and Ho Il Jin, chairman of the Korean Orthodox Church Committee, on Monday sent messages of condolences to Chairman of the Office of Foreign Relations of the Russian Orthodox Church Kirill who is patriarch of Smolensk and Kaliningrad Regions over the death of Patriarch Alexy II of the Russian Orthodox Church.
					 His death is a great loss for the Russian Orthodox Church and people, the messages said, praying for the immortality of the deceased.

articles.title: Officials of DPRK Religious Bodies Visit Russian Embassy
articles.content:
Officials of DPRK Religious Bodies Visit Russian Embassy
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Officials of religious organizations in the DPRK visited the Russian embassy here on Dec. 8 to express condolences over the death of Patriarch Alexy II of the Russian Orthodox Church.
					 Among the visitors were Jang Jae On, chairman of the Korean Council of Religionists, and Ho Il Jin, chairman of the Korean Orthodox Church Committee, and other officials of the committee.
					
					 The visitors observed a moment's silence in memory of the late Alexy II.
					
					 They made entries in the condoler's book.

articles.title: President of Montenegro on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
President of Montenegro on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Filip Vujanovic, President of Montenegro, expressed his will to further develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries when receiving the credentials from the DPRK ambassador to Montenegro on Dec. 1.
					 I am rejoiced over the fact that the Korean people have steadily made successes in the efforts to attain the state's ultimate goal, closely united around General Secretary Kim Jong Il and holding him in high esteem, and extend heartfelt congratulation to them, he said, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people's efforts will bear greater fruit in the future and they will certainly realize their cause already started.
					
					 I am sure that the problem of Korea's reunification will be peacefully solved in the interests of the Korean people.

articles.title: Book "Among People" Off Press
articles.content:
Book "Among People" Off Press
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 77 of "Among the People", a collection of reminiscences.
					 The book contains "Unforgettable Story about the Foundation of the Republic", "Whenever Marking the Anniversary of the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo" and 15 other reminiscences which deal with the immortal exploits and noble personality of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Unio Habitat of Taedong River, Natural Treasure
articles.content:
Unio Habitat of Taedong River, Natural Treasure
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A great attention is directed to the protection and management of natural treasure in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The unio habitat of Taedong River has been registered as a natural treasure. 
					
					Lots of unio live in both riversides of Taedong River in front of Pongdo-ri six kilometres northeast of Richon-ri, Sungho District, Pyongyang.
					
					Various measures are being taken to make good conditions for the unio to spawn in the winter season.
					
					The unio belong to the Unionidae.
					
					Its shell is 11 centimeters in length, seven centimeters in height and six centimeters in width.
					
					Its external shape is bulging, long and round and the shell is very thick and hard.
					
					The unio, living on diatoms, green algae and others, fully grow up in three years and each spawns some 200,000 eggs in winter.
					
					Being the unio feed and propagation site, the place of the river is being protected well as a natural treasure of the country.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Stop Its Moves to Turn Itself into Military Power
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Stop Its Moves to Turn Itself into Military Power
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Japan had better face up to the reality with a cool head and drop its foolish ambition. Rodong Sinmun Monday urges this in a signed commentary blasting the very dangerous moves under way in Japan these days.
					 All what is happening in Japan cannot be construed otherwise than undisguised moves for overseas expansion and a scenario to convert it into a military giant, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The "bill on special measures for activities to combat piracy" drafted by the Japanese government is basically aimed, to all intents and purposes, at expanding the scope of overseas actions of the "Self-Defense Forces (SDF)" and increasing the possibility of reinvasion.
					
					 The bill calls for allowing the "legitimate self-defense" of the SDF and "use of weapons against pirates in case they resist with arms." This is in contravention of the present Constitution of Japan.
					
					 The Japanese government singled out the "wider use of satellites for national security purpose" as one of the basic ways for space development program. This is designed to embark upon the road of reinvasion by realizing its ambition to emerge a military power and rounding off the capability to mount a preemptive attack.
					
					 By making a military use of space the Japanese reactionaries seek to have the military targets of strategic importance in their neighboring countries including the DPRK at their fingertips and disable those targets through preemptive attacks to be mounted from space any moment. This dangerous scenario can never come true. 
					
					 Japan is keen to realize the military use of space and its ambition for reinvasion backed by the U.S.
					
					 The development of midsize GX rocket had already been shelved at the meeting of a special panel of the Strategic Headquarters for Space Development under the Japanese government as its expenses are expected to be treble the original spending and there arose the problem concerning the need of satellites. However, the Japanese government decided to go ahead with the development of the rocket regardless of the expenses and their need. This betrays the impatience and ambition of Japan to hasten the military use of space as early as possible, come what may.
					
					 These frantic moves of the Japanese government and the SDF clearly indicate the criminal attempt of Japan to justify the moves for turning itself into a military power and launch reinvasion.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Talk about "Principle" and "Sincerity" Refuted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Talk about "Principle" and "Sincerity" Refuted
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak, addressing a recent "meeting of ministers concerned with foreign affairs and security," again talked about a sort of "principle" and "sincerity," blustering that south Korea "should be consistent in dealing with the issue of the north." 
					Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday says: What Lee uttered is an extremely treacherous act of challenging the demand of the era of independent reunification and the desire of the fellow countrymen as it betrays the intention of Lee to persistently stand in confrontation with the north with an eye to bring the inter-Korean relations to a collapse.
					
					The "policy toward the north" touted by him with a noisy advertisement that he would do something big is a treacherous policy which can result in nothing but deteriorating the inter-Korean relations and straining the situation on the Korean Peninsula, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is highly ridiculous of Lee to talk about a sort of "sincerity" while defending his "policy toward the north" with rhetoric about "consistency" and "principle." It is obvious that what the Lee group wants is not improved inter-Korean relations but their uncontrollable collapse. 
					
					 Needless to say, his outbursts are a revelation of his ulterior intention to conceal the unpardonable crime he committed by pushing the inter-Korean relations to the phase of total stalemate and further deteriorate the present situation in a bid to start a war of aggression against the north. This once again brought to light the true colors of the Lee group as traitors blatantly challenging the demand of the times for independent reunification, peace and prosperity and the aspiration of the fellow countrymen.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations will never get rid of the present serious crisis as long as Lee insists on his anachronistic "policy toward the north," trumpeting about "principle" and the like.

articles.title: Trade Union Leader Arrested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Trade Union Leader Arrested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The puppet police of south Korea arrested Ri Sok Haeng, chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, on Friday, according to south Korean CBS.
					 The police issued a warrant of arrest for the chairman in late July on the charge that he led the actions against American beef import. And it had conducted a roundup operation before arresting him in Koyang City, Kyonggi Province, on the night of December 5.
					
					 Such unceasing campaign of arresting those involved in the candlelight actions proves that the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is getting evermore pronounced in the moves to eliminate the progressive forces.

articles.title: Joint Struggle against "Government" Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint Struggle against "Government" Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- At least 500 political parties and civic and public organizations in south Korea, including the People's Council for Public Welfare and Democracy, the Joint Conference of Civic and Public Organizations and the Democratic Labor Party, held a meeting in Seoul on December 4 at which they declared that they would wage joint actions against traitor Lee Myung Bak's unpopular economic policy.
					 The participants in the meeting charged that the economic policy pursued by the present "government" serves only a handful of the rich and big businesses and that Lee Myung Bak insisting on the "policy for the richest who account for just one percent of the population" is the worst trouble-maker.
					
					 They urged the "government" to roll back its unpopular economic policy and take measures for the people's livelihood.
					
					 Noting that only the overwhelming majority of people have undergone sufferings and the gap between the poor and the rich has widened since the international monetary crisis late in 1997, they held that the "government" should not let the people suffer misfortune in this extremely serious economic crisis.
					
					 They urged the Lee Myung Bak "government" to take steps for stabilizing the people's livelihood and solving the problems of jobs, part-time workers and minor enterprises, etc. 
					
					 They declared that the political camp and the civic and public circles would struggle in solidarity to have such demands met.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised in Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised in Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A reading session on "Biography of Comrade Kim Jong Il" and a show of Korean film "75th Anniversary of the Heroic Korean People's Army" took place in Ethiopia on Dec. 1 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 The chairperson of the Addis Ababa Youth Association of Ethiopia said at the reading session that Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il made distinguished contribution to building the powerful national defence industry and developing the KPA into an invincible army.
					
					 It is entirely thanks to Kim Jong Il who assumed the KPA supreme commandership that the Songun idea and leadership exploits of President Kim Il Sung have been successfully carried forward and the DPRK has turned into a world-leading military power, the chairperson said, adding:
					
					 The DPRK has squarely stood up to the United States, with tough counteractions. The secret of such attitude lies in the strong faith and pluck, matchless courage and will to annihilate the enemy, all of which Kim Jong Il, outstanding strategist and greatest-ever commander, is possessed
					
					 It is precious truth proven by the Songun politics that the only powerful national defence capability can reliably ensure peace and security.

articles.title: Week of Korean Film Show Held in Cuba
articles.content:
Week of Korean Film Show Held in Cuba
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A week of Korean film show was held with due ceremony in Cuba from Nov. 28 to Dec. 1.
					 Present at the ceremony of opening the week were personages of the Cuban Art and Film Production Association and the Ministry of Culture, citizens in Havana, diplomatic envoys of different countries to Cuba and the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Havana.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Then the participants watched Korean film "The Flower Girl".
					
					 "Wolmi Island," "Order No. 027" and other Korean films were screened during the week of the film show.

articles.title: Religiosos expresan condolencias por fallecimiento de Alexy II
articles.content:
Religiosos expresan condolencias por fallecimiento de Alexy II
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del fallecimiento del Patriarca de la Iglesia Ortodoxa de Rusia, Alexy II, el presidente del Consejo de Religiosos de Corea, Jang Jae On, y el titular del Comite Coreano de Iglesia Ortodoxa, Ho Il Jin, enviaron este lunes telegramas de condolencias a Kirill, presidente de la Oficina de Relaciones Exteriores de la Iglesia Ortodoxa y patriarca de Smolensk y Kaliningrad.
					El fallecimiento de Alexy II constituye una gran perdida para la Iglesia Ortodoxa y el pueblo de Rusia, senalan las misivas y desean al difunto la beatitud y eternidad.

articles.title: Funcionarios coreanos realizan visita de condolencia a embajada rusa
articles.content:
Funcionarios coreanos realizan visita de condolencia a embajada rusa
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del fallecimiento del patriarca de la Iglesia Ortodoxa de Rusia, Alexy II, los funcionarios de las entidades religiosas de Corea visitaron este lunes la Embajada de la Federacion Rusa en Corea para expresar condolencias.
					Entre los visitantes figuraban el titular del Consejo de Religiosos de Corea, Jang Jae On, el presidente Ho Il Jin y otros funcionarios del Comite Coreano de Iglesia Ortodoxa.
					
					Ellos guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto y dejaron letras en el libro de condolencias.

articles.title: Presidente de Montenegro se refiere a relaciones con Corea
articles.content:
Presidente de Montenegro se refiere a relaciones con Corea
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tras recibir el dia primero las cartas credenciales del embajador coreano en su pais, el presidente de Montenegro, Filip Vujanovic, expreso la voluntad de desarrollar activamente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					En la ocasion el mandatario senalo que se alegra de los exitos que el pueblo coreano, unido monoliticamente en torno al Dirigente Kim Jong Il, logra de continuo en la realizacion del proposito maximo del Estado y lo felicita sinceramente y subrayo:
					
					 Los esfuerzos del pueblo coreano daran mayor fruto en el futuro y haran lograr sin falta la causa presentada ya.
					
					Estoy seguro que el problema de la reunificacion de Corea se resolvera por via pacifica conforme a los intereses del pueblo coreano.

articles.title: Japon debe separarse de su pasado ignominioso, senala Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japon debe separarse de su pasado ignominioso, senala Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- En ocasion del 67o aniversario de la Guerra del Pacifico desatada por el imperialismo japones, el periodico Minju Joson divulgo el dia 7 un comentario individual insistiendo en la liquidacion total del sucio pasado de este pais isleno.
					El texto resumido del comentario sigue:
					
					Hoy dia, deviene la corriente de la epoca en el ambito mundial que numerosos paises reconocen sinceramente la historia y comienzan de nuevo para el futuro.
					
					Ellos no escatiman el tiempo, el dinero y los esfuerzos para limpiar las manchas en el alma y la conciencia, bien conscientes de que no podran avanzar al futuro esplendido con las trayectorias ignominiosas del pasado.
					
					Sin embargo, Japon burla y desafia frontalmente a tal corriente de la epoca.
					
					En lugar de ciertas senales de pedir disculpas e indemnizar, en ese pais-isla se cometen a plena luz del dia inimaginables disparates y locuras.
					
					Lo grave del problema es que la incorrecta actitud sobre la historia y la falta de culpabilidad en cuanto a los crimenes del pasado de los reaccionarios japoneses se basan en sus tenaces pretensiones de realizar la ambicion expansionista a ultramar mediante el militarismo.
					
					 Japon esta dispuesto en todo para provocar una guerra ahora mismo si lo quisiera.
					
					Esto demuestra que Japon ya emergio como peligrosa fuerza belica de Asia y la amenaza militar y la provocacion de nueva guerra por este pais comenzaron a adquirir la peligrosidad real.
					
					Aunque afortunadamente este pais-isla pudo salvarse en el pasado aun siendo provocador de la guerra, no le tocara otra vez esta suerte.
					
					Las maniobras de Japon para lanzar nueva agresion al continente asiatico adelantaran solo su autodestruccion total.
					
					El destino de Japon dependera de su opcion ante la disyuntiva: comenzar de nuevo tras liquidar cabalmente su pasado ignominioso o echarse en el basurero de la historia.
